title: Logo for my web and art direction company
content:
Hi guys and gals

I have made a new logo for my company.

I have designed it from scratch, and I'm a font-designer-newbie, so I really would like some tips on how to get it to work...

Thanks in advance.

See the old here: [http://tinyurl.com/lz22a6](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107161659/http:/tinyurl.com/lz22a6 "http://tinyurl.com/lz22a6")

New logo is attached.

| --- | --- |

author: ZUZ3L

comments.content:
When I was looking at it for the first time, something seemed to confuse me. That's the reason why I took a screenshot and inserted a baseline and the x-height. The attatched screenshot kind of reveals the issues very quickly. First thing you have to do is achieving a better vertical alignment. Regarding to the baseline, all your letters -- except the "a" -- are just touching it instead of cutting into it, to balance the stem of the "a". Concerning the x-height, your "a" is way to small and should be raised up to the height of "e". All in all you need to take a closer look at the vertical alignment of round and straight elements. Maybe [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107161659/http:/typophile.com/node/61157) helps you understanding what I mean. Maybe anyone else knows a better example.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107161659im_/http:/typophile.com/files/blueblau_6016.jpg)

Thank you for your reply.

I have adjusted the x-height, and redrawed the cut-off on the B's, L's and the A. Further more, I have put on the logo on white background.

Sorry for my bad English.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107161659im_/http:/typophile.com/files/blueblau%20nyt%20logo-02-2-02-02_6532.jpg)

ue, bl and au all look too tight. Maybe eb a little too.

Ross
the kerning is very inconsistent. More obvious are the 2 "bl".

I know... That was not so good... I guess I made it a litte bit too fast.. :-)

What do you think about the lettering?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107161659im_/http:/typophile.com/files/blueblau%20nyt%20logo2-02_5453.jpg)
The kerning between the both of the bl's needs to be the same.

While this new one looks more "creative" the old one is more consistent.  
I'd try to make the l and e's ending angles like the a (90°) and let it breathe a bit more!  
By the way, nice site! even if the title is "Design that speaks every language" but there's not an english version.

I dunno. To me the type seems ... incomplete

----------  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Design Melbourne](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107161659/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)

I think the gaps/stencils are too big and unfrequenced.  
May I ask which font you've used in your old logo and title?

Kind regards,  
Martijn van Berkel

I am not sure i like the blue on blue thing....

How does this reproduce in mono - would be interested to see without colour.
